articles.title: I tested 30 smart locks, and these are the best
articles.summary: A new review highlights the Kwikset Halo Select smart lock, praised for its robust security features, aesthetic design, and seamless integration with smart home systems. This lock is significant as it offers advanced functionalities like auto-unlock based on location and compatibility with major platforms, enhancing user convenience and security. Key implications include the potential for improved home automation experiences and the ongoing evolution of smart home technology standards, such as Matter, which may further enhance compatibility and performance in the future.

articles.title: Anthropic and the Department of Defense to advance responsible AI in defense operations
articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Defense has awarded Anthropic a two-year, $200 million contract to prototype advanced AI capabilities aimed at enhancing national security. This collaboration is significant as it leverages Anthropic's expertise in responsible AI to address critical defense challenges and mitigate adversarial risks. Key next steps include developing tailored AI prototypes for the DOD, sharing technical insights for responsible AI adoption, and expanding Anthropic's existing partnerships within the public sector.

articles.title: Google swears it isn’t destroying the web with AI search
articles.summary: Google's Search head, Liz Reid, announced that the company's AI search features are not negatively impacting overall website traffic, despite claims from a recent Pew Research report suggesting a decline in clicks when AI-generated summaries are presented. This assertion is significant as it counters concerns from digital publishers facing traffic drops, particularly those reliant on traditional content formats, while highlighting a shift in user engagement towards sites with in-depth and original content. Moving forward, Google plans to enhance its search capabilities further with AI-curated results, indicating ongoing evolution in how users interact with search engines and content online.

articles.title: Anthropic to sign the EU Code of Practice
articles.summary: Anthropic has announced its intention to sign the European Union's General-Purpose AI Code of Practice, emphasizing its commitment to transparency, safety, and accountability in AI development. This move is significant as it aligns with the EU's strategy to harness AI's potential to boost the economy by over a trillion euros annually by the mid-2030s, while ensuring that innovation and safety standards coexist. Key implications include the establishment of mandatory safety frameworks and a collaborative approach with regulatory bodies, which will be crucial for adapting to the rapidly evolving AI landscape and addressing systemic risks.

articles.title: Automate security reviews with Claude Code
articles.summary: Today, Claude Code introduced automated security reviews through a new /security-review command and GitHub Actions integration, allowing developers to identify and fix security vulnerabilities directly from their terminal and during pull requests. This is significant as it enhances code security in an era where rapid development increases the risk of vulnerabilities, ensuring that security checks are integrated into existing workflows. Key implications include a more consistent security review process across teams, reducing the likelihood of vulnerabilities reaching production and improving overall product security.

articles.title: OpenAI teases GPT-5 launch event this Thursday
articles.summary: OpenAI is set to unveil its highly anticipated GPT-5 AI model during a livestream event on Thursday at 10 AM PT, hinted at through a clever play on words in their announcement. This significant reveal follows recent indications from CEO Sam Altman and other company executives, suggesting a strategic push to enhance AI capabilities and user engagement. Key implications include potential advancements in AI applications and increased competition in the AI space, particularly as Microsoft prepares its infrastructure to support the new model.

articles.title: Paul Smith to join Anthropic as Chief Commercial Officer
articles.summary: Anthropic has announced the appointment of Paul Smith as its first Chief Commercial Officer, effective later this year, as the company experiences significant growth in the enterprise market. This move is significant as it aims to enhance Anthropic's commercial capabilities and support the increasing demand for AI solutions among businesses, evidenced by a 5x growth in recurring revenue from its Claude Code product. Key implications include a strengthened go-to-market strategy that could accelerate AI adoption across various industries, positioning Anthropic as a leading partner in the ongoing AI transformation.

articles.title: National security expert Richard Fontaine appointed to Anthropic’s long-term benefit trust
articles.summary: Anthropic's Long-Term Benefit Trust has appointed Richard Fontaine, CEO of the Center for a New American Security, to its board, enhancing its focus on the intersection of advanced AI and national security. This appointment is significant as it brings critical expertise to address the geopolitical risks associated with transformative AI technologies, aligning with Anthropic's mission to ensure a safe transition through AI advancements. Moving forward, Fontaine's insights will guide Anthropic in navigating the complexities of AI's impact on global security and democratic institutions, reinforcing the Trust's role in shaping responsible AI development.

articles.title: Call of Duty and Battlefield 6 will both require Secure Boot on Windows
articles.summary: Activision will require Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 players on PC to enable Trusted Platform Module (TPM) 2.0 and Windows' Secure Boot feature to enhance anti-cheat measures, although these settings won't be enforced until the game's release later this year. Additionally, EA has announced that Battlefield 6 will also require these features for its upcoming open beta, while both companies emphasize that these security measures should not affect in-game performance.

articles.title: I tested Grok’s Valentine sex chatbot and it (mostly) behaved
articles.summary: The article discusses the launch of Valentine, Grok's new AI companion designed for adult interactions, highlighting its cautious approach to conversation and its limitations in engaging with explicit content compared to its predecessor, Ani. The author notes concerns about the AI's biases, the unsettling default microphone settings that capture surrounding conversations, and the overall experience of navigating consent and boundaries within the interactions.
